messageBody:
Like Mike Clark, from the unit testing perspective, I consider the
message-driven bean to be a controller, a supervisor. It receives a
message, hands the message contents to some other object to parse, takes the
result and gives it to another object to do some actual work, then takes
that result and hands it to an object that knows how to communicate the
result elsewhere. I then unit test these other objects, these
collaborators, and ignore the often very simple logic that remains in the
message-driven bean.

Craig
